thread.title: Webb uses ground game to win rematch
thread.title_full: Webb uses ground game to win rematch - PrepXtra Story

author: Dave Link
title: Webb uses ground game to win rematch
text:
Webb School won the 2014 Division II-A state championship game rematch on Friday night.
The Spartans' ground out 442 rushing yards with their wing-T offense and beat Battle Ground Academy 35-28 in a non-region game.
Webb beat BGA 38-21 last year for its third straight state title.
Junior fullback Tommy Jordan rushed for 158 yards and four touchdowns on 25 carries for the Spartans (4-3).
Jordan bounced back from his first-quarter fumble near the goal line when the ball bounced out of the end zone for a touchback.
Jordan scored three 1-yard touchdown runs and scored on a 15-yard run.
The game was delayed 2 hours, 6 minutes due to lightning.
BGA's Clay Beathard, a Division II-A Mr. Football winner in 2014, completed 16 of 25 passes for 302 yards, but the rushing game was held to just 13 yards.
Beathard threw a 54-yard TD pass to Marcus Cawthorne on the third play of the game for a 7-0 lead.
Jordan's 1-yard run tied it with 37 seconds left in the first quarter.
The game was tied at 7, 14, 21, and 28.
BGA (5-2) scored all of its touchdowns on big plays.
Terrell Webster intercepted a pass by Hunter Green and returned it 38 yards for BGA's second touchdown.
Beathard also threw a 60-yard TD pass to Cawthorne, and his 80-yard TD pass to Webster tied the game at 28 with 9:44 left.
Webb moved 50 yards on 11 plays and scored on Jordan's 1-yard run.
Andrew Favaro's PAT kick made it 35-28 with 4:20 left.
The Spartans' go-ahead drive was kept alive by a defensive holding penalty on third-and-8.
BGA started its last drive at the 50.
Andrew Craig sacked Beathard on first down.
After an incomplete pass, Beathard was sacked by Sam Seifert.
Beathard threw an 11-yard completion on fourth down to JP Pasley, who was tackled short of the first down by Craig.
Webb's Juwaan Jefferson rushed for 119 yards on 16 carries.
Alexander Berube gained 83 yards on 10 carries and Jahlil Jefferson ran for 57 yards on 11 carries for the Spartans.
Dave Link is a freelance contributor.
